meanings.sent1: The villain offed the hero in the movie.
meanings.sent2: The detective solved the case when he discovered who offed the victim.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy assassin accidentally offed the wrong target.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal offed her trust in him forever.
meanings.sent5: The poison offed the plant's leaves, turning them brown and withered.

meanings.definition: To turn off or deactivate something.
meanings.sent1: Remember to off the lights before leaving the room.
meanings.sent2: He offed the alarm clock to stop the annoying sound.
meanings.sent3: She offed the TV to enjoy a peaceful evening without distractions.
meanings.sent4: The power outage offed all the electronic devices in the house.
meanings.sent5: The switch offed the flow of electricity to the machine, halting its operation.
